name: Bulbasaur
fact: Bulbasaur's plant grows steadily larger as it gains experience, and it can use its poison to its advantage.

name: Ivysaur
fact: Ivysaur is a transition Pokémon that evolves from Bulbasaur and its plant grows even more, enhancing its poison abilities.

name: Venusaur
fact: Venusaur's flower emits a foul odor that can cause a sickening effect on its foes.

name: Nidoran♀
fact: Nidoran♀ has toxic barbs on its body that can inject poison into its enemies.

name: Nidorina
fact: Nidorina's poisonous barbs are sharper and more dangerous than those of Nidoran♀.

name: Nidoqueen
fact: Nidoqueen can use its poisonous claws and horn to fend off opponents.

name: Nidoran♂
fact: Nidoran♂ has poison spikes on its back that can be used to defend itself when threatened.

name: Nidorino
fact: Nidorino's poison is more potent and its horns are sharper than those of Nidoran♂.

name: Nidoking
fact: Nidoking's powerful poison can incapacitate its enemies with a single touch.

name: Grimer
fact: Grimer's body is composed of toxic sludge, and it can melt anything it touches.

name: Muk
fact: Muk's body is a highly toxic sludge that can contaminate entire areas.

name: Crobat
fact: Crobat's poisonous fangs are used in its quick, powerful attacks.

name: Gengar
fact: Gengar can manipulate shadows and is known for its mischievous and spooky nature.

name: Weezing
fact: Weezing's body is a cluster of toxic gases that it releases to poison its enemies.
